required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Achilles Tendon Rupture - Choice of Treatment Based on Ultrasound Findings
clinical_study.official_title: Diagnostic UltraSonography for the Choice of Treatment of Acute Achilles Tendon Rupture

brief_summary.textblock: Patients with acute achilles tendon rupture will go through an acute ultrasound. Based on the distance between the ends of the tendon the investigators will decide if the patient is going to be treated with or without surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in functional outcome between patients treated surgically and non-surgically
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome will be a comparison of function by the heel-rise work test developed by Silbernagel et al. This is a validated test which combines both the height of each heel-rise and the number of repetitions.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in functional outcome between patients treated surgically and non-surgically
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome will be a comparison of function by the heel-rise work test developed by Silbernagel et al. This is a validated set of tests measuring vertical jump, strength and endurance

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in functional outcome between patients treated surgically and non-surgically
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome will be a comparison of function by the heel-rise work test developed by Silbernagel et al. This is a validated set of tests measuring vertical jump, strength and endurance

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in functional outcome between patients treated surgically and non-surgically
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome will be a comparison of function by the heel-rise work test developed by Silbernagel et al. This is a validated set of tests measuring vertical jump, strength and endurance

secondary_outcome.description: Achilles tendon length - measured using US extended field of view

arm_group.description: Patients with a distance of 5 mm or more between tendon ends will be treated surgically and with physiotherapy
Patients with a distance of less than 5 mm between tendon ends will be treated non-surgically and with physiotherapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- acute achilles tendon rupture diagnosed less than 48 hours from injury
- mid-substance rupture
Exclusion Criteria:
- previous achilles tendon rupture
- lower leg disability
- diabetes mellitus
- neurovascular disease
- immunosuppression
- non-Swedish speaker
